alert.note: Alert for Hancock (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 06 at 2:56PM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: .A wave of showers and isolated thunderstorms will lift northward into the region this evening, followed by another wave of showers and embedded thunderstorms tonight into early Monday morning. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM EST /6 PM CST/ THIS EVENING THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of Indiana and northwest Kentucky, including the following counties, in Indiana, Crawford, Dubois, Orange, Perry, and Washington. In northwest Kentucky, Hancock. * WHEN...From 7 PM EST /6 PM CST/ this evening through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
